game_description: The Horizon scientific research laboratory is a deceptively quiet place. When you came round, there were hundreds of the living dead all around you. All because of that damn T12 virus. To survive and save the world from the virus, use both hands and your head: never stop shooting, pick up rounds, climb up pipes and ladders, jump onto bars and grab hold of ropes, search cupboards and throw everything you find at the zombies. You‚Äôre free to choose whatever weapons and tactics you want. Prove your agility, imagination and accuracy. The denizens of the Horizon station will punish you for one thing: hesitation. * FEATURES * ‚óè Realistic bloody graphics in the spirit of zombie apocalypse films ‚óè Use two controllers actively: fire with both hands, fire as you hang on a rope, reload your shotgun with your second hand, grab onto pipes and explore hard-to-reach areas of the station

review_3: It's good and sometimes fun but the problem with this game is stress. Half of it is intentional however. Problem is that you need a big area you can wander about in because if you're climbing through the vents which you can only do with your hands, then you'll have to physically turn your body and you cant use the stick. Which is annoying. Also the guns are pretty good but they're a big fiddle about sometimes, it's not always clear what will register as a weapon holster. Big issue is the melee weapons dont work. They're a tutorial for it at the start but I died 9 times trying to do it because I hit the undead jammy doger factory worker in the head with my massive stiff bat and nothing happens. Very annoying. Plus the levels are very generic and basically the same. To the point where you are going down corridors and you know where the zombies are going to come from because they came from those vents either side of the door to the level last five times so why not again? Not reason why not, and they do. I quit playing when I glitched through the level because I peeked out of a vent and my head accidentally went through the wall and I fell through the map and died. Actually that's I lied, I quit the 6th time that happened because by then I was really too angry. My summary is that its functional and you can use it but its unfinished and could have been a good game but it's clearly been a project that someone gave up on at some point.
